column2: an A.M. Eatery////We ate here last Saturday. We waited over an hour to be seated. From the time we were seated
column3: it took an additional hour to receive our food. That's two hours to get food. The food is decent
column4: but the long wait time unfortunately makes this an establishment I won't come back to. I can get a large home cooked breakfast at House of Pies in our Galleria neighborhood that's comparable to this place
column5: but at about $2-$5 less per plate
column6: and less wait time. Was nice to try once- the indoor decor was definitely cool.
